timeline.speaker: elon
timeline.text: So, class, this article on fluid dynamics… what's the core concept?  It's all about how stuff flows, right?

timeline.speaker: trump
timeline.text: Yeah, flowing! Bigly flowing!  Like, the best flowing you've ever seen!  It's huge, it's tremendous. What about the, uh,  pipes?

timeline.speaker: elon
timeline.text: It's not just about pipes, Donald.  Think of it like this: water going down a hill. Gravity pulls it, pressure pushes it. Simple, right?  It's the same with air, gases—even blood in your arteries. It's all about energy and pressure differences.

timeline.speaker: trump
timeline.text: So it's like, a big, beautiful flow of…  energy?  The best energy, folks, the best. Believe me.  So, like, my new golf course water system?  Total fluid dynamics mastery.

timeline.speaker: elon
timeline.text: Not exactly. It’s more nuanced than that. The article also discusses laminar vs. turbulent flow. Think of a smooth, steady stream from a tap versus a chaotic waterfall.  It’s about  predictability of the flow.

timeline.speaker: trump
timeline.text: Yeah,  predictable like my… uh, my election win!  Totally predictable!  It was, you know…  the best flowing situation, everybody agreed.  Fake news!  So the turbulent flow is bad? SAD!
